title: Formula Bounty
author: Formula Bounty
created_time: March 02, 2023, 09:56:35 PMLast edit: March 12, 2023, 01:39:58 AM by Formula Bounty
content: Training sold. I am currently closing the sale.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I can't imagine that anyone would trust dealing with someone that has nothing but negative trust feedback.  Not a single positive feedback and a sea of negative makes me wonder why you don't just abandon this account, admit to yourself that you failed at trying to scam, and maybe trying again only being positive and trying to contribute something instead of steal from others.  I assume you don't abandon the account because you paid for a Copper Membership, which is so cheap that holding the account for that reason is enough of a red flag that I don't think anyone would be willing to trade with you.  I don't mean to be rude, but unless this is a tactic used to lure in only people who are idiots, it's a bad look.  Even if that is the case, still a bad look.

comments.author: Formula Bounty
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on March 03, 2023, 07:14:06 PMI can't imagine that anyone would trust dealing with someone that has nothing but negative trust feedback.  Not a single positive feedback and a sea of negative makes me wonder why you don't just abandon this account, admit to yourself that you failed at trying to scam, and maybe trying again only being positive and trying to contribute something instead of steal from others.  I assume you don't abandon the account because you paid for a Copper Membership, which is so cheap that holding the account for that reason is enough of a red flag that I don't think anyone would be willing to trade with you.  I don't mean to be rude, but unless this is a tactic used to lure in only people who are idiots, it's a bad look.  Even if that is the case, still a bad look.  "I can't imagine that anyone would trust dealing with someone that has nothing but negative trust feedback." - What? I specifically posted this from an account that has more than 100+ bounty campaigns running, writed links to a channel where you can identify me and offered a bitcointalk guarantor.Well, if you spent a minute of your time, you would see that I have a negative trust due to the fact that some projects refused to pay out tokens to participants, and not because I deceived someone in the deal. Secondly, you can open my channel and see how many bounties I have launched and roughly calculate my income. I am ready to provide the buyer with data on earnings. I am also ready to use the bitcointalk guarantor. Your post looks like you should just post without thinking.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: To be precise, the comments do not only indicate that you are a scammer, but that you support and continue to support scam as long as the scammers pay you.QuoteUnprofessional bounty manager, supporting many scams project without carrying about the bounty hunters as long as he has been paid (previous account : persgrata)So, what you offer is a platform that helps scam projects, and whoever buys them may end up with legal problems, not to mention the moral aspect of continuing to support such scam.Therefore, there is no guarantee that the profits of the platform are 70k USD per year, and there is no guarantee that can guarantee that because you want your money now, while proving that the buyer will reach 70K needs several months.

comments.author: Formula Bounty
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on March 04, 2023, 08:53:36 AMTo be precise, the comments do not only indicate that you are a scammer, but that you support and continue to support scam as long as the scammers pay you.QuoteUnprofessional bounty manager, supporting many scams project without carrying about the bounty hunters as long as he has been paid (previous account : persgrata)So, what you offer is a platform that helps scam projects, and whoever buys them may end up with legal problems, not to mention the moral aspect of continuing to support such scam.Therefore, there is no guarantee that the profits of the platform are 70k USD per year, and there is no guarantee that can guarantee that because you want your money now, while proving that the buyer will reach 70K needs several months."So, what you offer is a platform that helps scam projects, and whoever buys them may end up with legal problems, not to mention the moral aspect of continuing to support such scam."Are you serious? That is, for you, the review of some person is already proof? You are too naive. Believing every review without checking the activity is beyond stupidity. I hope you're not affiliated with the law enforcement.Regarding the guarantee - I indicated that I was ready to provide my income for confirmation."because you want to get your money now" - in my opinion, I specified that I was ready to accept parts through a guarantor.As I said earlier - Your post looks like you should just post without thinking. Why do you write without reading? You look too stupid.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: Formula Bounty on March 04, 2023, 03:15:42 PMAre you serious? That is, for you, the review of some person is already proof? You are too naive. Believing every review without checking the activity is beyond stupidity. I hope you're not affiliated with the law enforcement.Your trust summary suggests that you have a track record of promoting obvious scam projects without conducting any due diligence, and even continuing bounty campaigns despite being alerted of their fraudulent nature by other members. This shows that your primary concern is your own financial gain, with little regard for the well-being of others. Trust summary for Formula Bounty:Quote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=3488354 shasan    2023-03-03    Reference    Promoting scam project and didn't lock the project after giving warning. FatFork    2023-03-03    Reference    Promoting scam/fraudulent projects.  icopress    2022-08-12    Reference    Avoid this bounty manager. Persgrata/Formula Bounty, belligerent and irresponsible user who launches fraudulent projects aimed at people who do not understand and do not want to take cryptocurrencies too seriously. sharos    2022-07-03    Reference    Partners of serial scammer. Created multiple account to hushed previous bad records.Trust summary for persgrata:Quote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=2407868 icopress    2022-08-12    Reference    Avoid this bounty manager. Persgrata/Formula Bounty, belligerent and irresponsible user who launches fraudulent projects aimed at people who do not understand and do not want to take cryptocurrencies too seriously. logfiles    2022-06-19    Reference    Manages various scam bounties and do not carry out Due diligence Jawhead999    2020-12-31    Reference    Unprofessional bounty manager, multiply managing scam project sharos    2022-06-19    Reference    Promoting scam project partyland. Unprofessional activities- If user complaint about his scam promotion, This manager decide to ban themPromoting questionable or fraudulent projects without conducting proper research is not a good feature of any serious business because it undermines the credibility and integrity of the business. By prioritizing financial gain over the well-being of others, a business risks damaging its reputation and losing the trust of its customers and partners, and can also lead to legal and ethical issues for the business. Quote from: Formula Bounty on March 04, 2023, 03:15:42 PMYou look too stupid.Wow, I'm truly in awe of your level of professionalism. I can see why your business is such a smashing success.
